data: As he made his way out of the paddock Garrison carefully tilted his bag of Durham into the curved rice-paper held between nicotine-stained finger and thumb, then deftly rolled his “smoke” with the thumb and forefinger, while tying the bag with practised right hand and even white teeth.
Garrison's Finish: A Romance of the Race Course
W. B. M. (William Blair Morton) Ferguson
Ferguson, W. B. M. (William Blair Morton), 1882-1967
